      • getEmployees

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Employee> getEmployees(java.lang.String filePath)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Retrieves all of the employee objects stored in the .dat file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the .dat file.
        Returns:
        An array of all of the employees.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be read.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the readObject method could not find a suitable class definition for the Employee objects.

      • getCurrentEmployee

        private static Employee getCurrentEmployee(java.lang.String filePath)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Prompts the user for a valid ID to get the current employee.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the .dat file.
        Returns:
        The current employee based on the inputted ID or null if a valid ID was not supplied.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an exception when working with files or user input.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the readObject method could not find a suitable class definition for the Employee objects.
